result.execSummary:
The defendant Javod Diearre Petty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Court ordered 45 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the 
discretion of the probation department.
Successfully attend and complete a Batterer's Intervention program.
Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class.
Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment. Absolute sobriety.
No drugs without a valid prescription. Random screens.
No contact with the victim without the approval of the Court.
Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero).
Seek/maintain employment.
Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended  supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
No contact with firearms

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court orders defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing and pay the surcharge - if not already done.

miscConds.notes: Successfully attend and complete a Batterer's Intervention program.  Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class.  Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.  Attend the probation review hearing on 9-26-14.
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment. Absolute Sobriety.
No drugs without a valid prescription.  Random screens. No contact with the victim without approval of the court.
Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero).

No contact with firearms. Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for the use at the discretion of the probation department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javod Diearre Petty

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Per the probation agent, defendant incarcerated on another offense.  The 9/26/14 probation review is cancelled.  rmm
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 09-26-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  5 years with  97 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  3 years.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  3  years.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
-  SERVE  90 DAYS condition time, straight time, at the House of Correction.
- Court ordered  45 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Successfully attend and complete a Batterer's Intervention program
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Random screens
- No contact with the victim, without the approval of the Court.
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 09-26-2014.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
- Court ordered  45 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Successfully attend and complete a Batterer's Intervention program
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Random screens
- No contact with the victim without the approval of the Court.
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- No contact with firearms

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing and pay the surcharge - if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1:
On motion of the State, Court orders penalty enhancer DISMISSED.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty to the amended charge and enters a judgment of conviction.

As to Count 2:
On motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED, but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/21/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
from the state received and filed.  rmm
from the state received and filed.  rmm
Defense motion to modify bail is heard and granted by the Court.   mld

Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  FILE NOT IN COURT.
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Amanda Grimm.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery.  Due to the assignment of ADA Michael Schindhelm for ADA Molly Schmidt, case transferred to Branch 40.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 40 on 3-24-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 4-21-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Charmetha A

Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
